reviewText: Demonoid: Messenger of Death (1981) is certainly not horror cinema at its best, but it's the kind of film I enjoy.  There are a surprising degree of horror films built on the proposition that the human hand can act individually (usually to annihilate people) if severed from the body or if surgically attached to a new body.  In a Mexican mine, some ancient demon possesses the left hand of a woman.  Stuart Whitman and Samantha Eggar in the present, battle against that ancient bloodthirsty demon which possesses people's left hands.The Mexican director showed great imagination with an obviously low budget.  A very interesting horror film, low production values aside.
Title: N/A

reviewText: DEMONOID concerns a demonized left hand that creeps, crawls, leaps, and kills! It also possesses those it chooses, and uses them to further its agenda of eeevil! Samantha Eggar (A NAME FOR EVIL, THE BROOD) tracks the horrid hand, after it destroys her husband. Stuart Whitman (NIGHT OF THE LEPUS) plays a priest w/ all of the enthusiasm of soggy communion wafers. DEMONOID is much maligned (some of it deserved), but is still better than a lot of what passed for "horror" in the 80s! Never a dvd release? Why not??...
summary: I Always Knew That Left Hands Were EEEvil!...

reviewText: this is one of those movies that looks like the actors involved must have needed a paycheck because i can't believe that they would have been in this piece of junk.the "plot" if you can call it that is about the finding of a case that has the devils left hand in it and when opened it starts taking over each person it touches. it makes them do bad things like star in this turkey. no stars but they make you give 1 so beware of this stink fest
